author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...CHANTAL A LITTLE STRONGER AND CLOSE TO LANDFALL ALONG THE SOUTH CAROLINA COAST... ...FLASH FLOODING CONCERNS INCREASE AS RAINBANDS MOVES ONSHORE...
summary: ...CHANTAL A LITTLE STRONGER AND CLOSE TO LANDFALL ALONG THE SOUTH CAROLINA COAST... ...FLASH FLOODING CONCERNS INCREASE AS RAINBANDS MOVES ONSHORE... As of 2:00 AM EDT Sun Jul 06 the center of Chantal was located near 33.2, -78.8 with movement N at 8 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1002 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 60 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...CHANTAL A LITTLE STRONGER AND CLOSE TO LANDFALL ALONG THE SOUTH CAROLINA COAST... ...FLASH FLOODING CONCERNS INCREASE AS RAINBANDS MOVES ONSHORE... As of 2:00 AM EDT Sun Jul 06 the center of Chantal was located near 33.2, -78.8 with movement N at 8 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1002 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 60 mph.

title: Summary - Tropical Storm Chantal (AT3/AL032025)
